quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Diamond and Harry Potter
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, wilkie. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Name the villain in the movie Diamonds Are Forever in which James Bond impersonates a diamond smuggler.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blofeld

questions.question: In the classic French novel The Three Musketeers, young dArtagnan goes to England to retrieve Queen Annes diamond studs and protect her honor. Who had the Queen given the two diamond studs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Duke of Buckingham

questions.question: In order to get to Diagon Alley, Hagrid and Harry Potter had to pass through a pub first. What is the name of the pub?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Leaky Cauldron

questions.question: What is the unusual platform number on which Harry Potter has to catch his train - The Hogwarts Express?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: nine and three quarters

questions.question: At Ollivanders, the wand shop, Harry Potter bought a wand that contained which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a phoenix feather

questions.question: What was the advertising slogan for the diamond company that Matthew McConaugheys character came up with in the romantic comedy movie How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days?

options.text: They keep their shape, so do you.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ladies, frost yourself.

questions.question: Name the little creatures that own and operate the Gringotts Wizarding Bank in the Harry Potter series.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: goblins

questions.question: What actor stars as retired jewel thief opposite Grace Kelly in Alfred Hitchcocks romantic thriller To Catch a Thief?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cary Grant

questions.question: The 2007 movie Blood Diamond, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, is set during the civil war raging in this African country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Siera Leone

questions.question: What is the color of the huge diamond featured in a classic 1963 comedy movie starring Claudia Cardinale and Peter Sellers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: pink

questions.question: While getting fitted for a robe before his first year at Hogwarts, Harry Potter came across Neville Longbottom.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who is the author of the novella The Diamond as Big as the Ritz which is centered around a mountain consisting of one solid diamond?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: F. Scott Fitzgerald

questions.question: What classic musical comedy, directed by Howard Hawks, features Marilyn Monroes signature rendition of the song “Diamonds Are a Girl’s Best Friend”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gentlemen Prefer Blondes

questions.question: This novel by Wilkie Collins, generally considered the first detective novel in the English language, revolves around a precious Indian diamond of great religious significance.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Moonstone

questions.question: What is the name of the fictitious blue diamond which was featured prominently in James Camerons movie Titanic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Heart of the Ocean

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Amy Winehouse and Title
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, fruits, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: A wax sculpture at the London Madame Tussauds museum depicts Amy Winehouse lying in a pool of blood with an apple and a bullet hole in her head. The statue is a recreation of this American authors accidental manslaughter of his wife Joan Vollmer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Burroghs

questions.question: What is the title of Amy Winehouses debut album which spawned the singles Stronger Than Me, Take the Box, and Help Yourself?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frank

questions.question: Rice is the main ingredient of sushi.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Olive oil, herbs, garlic and lemon are typical flavours found in Lebanese cuisine.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What Grammy Award-winning song by Amy Winehouse references soul musicians Ray Charles and Donny Hathaway?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rehab

questions.question: Amy Winehouses song Tears Dry on Their Own samples the backing music from this 1967 smash hit recorded by Marvin Gaye and Tammi Terrell.

options.text: How Sweet It Is (To Be Loved by You)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aint No Mountain High Enough

questions.question: Which of these dishes is part of Mexican cuisine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What is the name of Amy Winehouses goddaughter whose debut album was released in 2009 through Amy Winehouses Lioness Records label?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dionne Bromfield

questions.question: From what 1960s girl group did Amy Winehouse borrow her signature beehive hairdo and the Cleopatra makeup?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Ronettes

questions.question: Which of these is a significant part of Greek cuisine?

options.text: Herbs specific to the Mediterranean region

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What American singer credited Amy Winehouse with paving the way for her rise to the top of the charts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lady Gaga

questions.question: This top fashion designer stated that Amy Winehouse was his new muse and even compared her to 1960s French actress Brigitte Bardot.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Karl Lagerfeld

questions.question: How old was Amy Winehouse when she died on 23 July 2011 at her home in London?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 27

questions.question: What is the name of Amy Winehouses 2006 album, which made her the first British female to win five Grammys?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Back to Black

questions.question: Sangria is made of wine and fruits and is one of the most popular drinks in this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spain

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Nymph and Zeus
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, aegina, deity. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the name of the nymph that transformed herself into a goat in order to feed Zeus when he was a baby?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Amaltheia

questions.question: What statement is true about Pyotr Arkadyevich Stolypin?

options.text: He served as Prime Minister of Russia.
He belonged to the Russian proletariat.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He served as Prime Minister of Russia.

questions.question: Escargot is a dish of cooked frogs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In this country paan is a custom practised after dinner.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: India

questions.question: Many Italian dishes consist of only 4 to 8 ingredients.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: When Hephaestus (God of Forging) was thrown out of the sky, he was found and raised by Thetis, the same nymph that later gave birth to a famous half mortal baby. This baby grew up to become one of the most famous Greek heroes. What was Thetis son called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Achilles

questions.question: What statement is true about Thai cuisine?

options.text: Thai food is often served with a variety of sauces.
Thai food was traditionally eaten with the right hand.
Thai food is known for its balance of the four main taste senses (sour, sweet, salty, and bitter).

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Dryads are also known as wood nymphs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: According to a mythological story, Zeus was cheating on his wife Hera with a nymph called Io. Just before Hera caught them, Zeus transformed Io into what animal to hide her true identity?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: cow

questions.question: Prince Alexander Nevsky was a Russian ruler during the Middle Ages.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In Chinese culture the use of a knife and fork on the table has been considered a barbaric habit.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Calypso was a mythological nymph who lived by herself on an island. Once a hero came to her land by mistake, and she entertained him while he stayed there. Who was this hero?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Odysseus

questions.question: Aegina was one of the many nymphs seduced by Zeus, but unlike some others, this nymph didnt get away with it. Which king caught Aegina and Zeus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sisyphus

questions.question: This deity used to be a mortal, but Aeneus desired her and cheated on his wife, Lavinia, with her. Lavinia got jealous, so the woman fled, and was taken away by the stream god, Numicus. Who is this woman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anna Perenna

questions.question: This talkative nymph was trying to protect her nymph friends from being caught with Zeus, so she tried to distract Hera while the others escaped. She talked and talked, and Hera got sick of it so she cursed the nymph to repeat everything everybody else said. What is the name of this nymph?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Echo

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Nymph and Zeus

questions.question: The name of the nymph who raised Zeus was Thetis.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which of these is a saying by Russian general Alexander Suvorov?

options.text: The bullet is a fool, the bayonet is a fine chap.
Perish yourself but rescue your comrade.
What is difficult in training will become easy in a battle.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Who was the first ruler to be crowned as Tsar of All Russia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ivan the Terrible

questions.question: Who wrote the notable works Crime and Punishment”, The Idiot” and The Brothers Karamazov”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

questions.question: When Thomas came home from the movies, he was asked who he went with. He replied with this riddle: my sisters brothers fathers wifes sisters son.  Who did he go to the movies with?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His cousin

questions.question: I go to an island where all of the natives lie, and all of the immigrants tell the truth. I would like to hire an immigrant as a guide, so when I see a group of people, I ask the first man if he is a immigrant. He does not reply, but instead tells me that the woman behind him told him that she was a native. With this information, should I hire this man?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: According to Greek mythology, what did Cronus do to Zeuss five siblings when they were born?

options.text: He hid them from the other titans.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He swallowed them.

questions.question: Lenin was the founder of the Soviet Communist Party.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: If a rooster is sitting on his egg in the middle of a roof with a 30 degree slant, when the wind comes from the north, which way will the rooster fall?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: none of these

questions.question: Artie is trying to enter a door, but he cant understand the instructions on the door sign which read:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Push

questions.question: Name the first Russian Tsar of the Romanov dynasty.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael of Russia

questions.question: Dmitri Mendeleev is the creator of the periodic table of elements.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In what form was the nymph who suckled Zeus in the cave?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: goat

questions.question: What Russian author of the Romantic era is often considered to be the founder of modern Russian literature?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alexander Pushkin

questions.question: When did Stalin become leader of the USSR?

options.text: after the death of Vladimir Ilyich Lenin in 1924
in 1922 when he became a Secretary of the Bolshevik Party

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: after the death of Vladimir Ilyich Lenin in 1924

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Warriors and Series
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, giza, hatshepsut. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: He was the son of Seti I and his successors and later Egyptians called him the Great Ancestor.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ramses II

questions.question: In the warriors series, according to Barely, what was Scourges greatest weakness?

options.text: He didnt care about his clanmates.
He had a soft-spot for the clans.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He didnt believe in Starclan.

questions.question: Who told Fireheart about Bluestars kits in the series Warriors?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Greypool

questions.question: Who did Warriors character Darkstripe feed a deathberry to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sorrelkit

questions.question: Why did Warriors character Yellowfang say she hated kits?

options.text: Because she had been abandoned as a kit
Because they only brought more mouths to feed
Because of her evil son Brokenstar, who should never have been born

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Because of her evil son Brokenstar, who should never have been born

questions.question: What pharaoh ascended to the throne when he was only nine years old and died at the age of 18?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tutankhamun

questions.question: She was the daughter of Thumose I and is regarded by Egyptologists as one of the most successful pharaohs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hatshepsut

questions.question: Who did Warriors character Fireheart save in the fire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bramblekit

questions.question: When Bluestar refuses to make them Warriors, these two apprentices go out alone to face the dark forces in the forest.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brightpaw and Swiftpaw

questions.question: In the Warriors series, Cinderpaw did not choose to be a medicine cat, but she secretly wanted to be Yellowfangs apprentice anyway.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In the Warriors series, why did Bluestar give Rusty the name of Firepaw?

options.text: Because of the prophecy (Fire will save the clan)
Because he looked like a brand of fire in the sunlight
The forest was currently dry, reminding her of fire.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Because he looked like a brand of fire in the sunlight

questions.question: Amenhotep I inherited the kingdom formed by his fathers conquests.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which pharaoh was co-regent to his stepmother Hatshepsut during the first twenty-two years of his reign?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thutmose III

questions.question: What statement is true about Akhenaten who ruled between 1379-1334 B.C.?

options.text: His chief wife was the beautiful Queen Nefertiti.
He introduced worship of one god, the Sun disc Aten.
He moved the capital from Memphis to Akhetaten.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Khafra is credited with building the second pyramid at Giza, as well as the majestic Great Sphinx of Giza.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True
